revised_title: Fossil Flora of North Greenland: Contributions and Discoveries by Edward Whymper and Oswald Heer
tldr: The authors present a detailed study of the fossil flora found in North Greenland, focusing on the plants collected by Edward Whymper during the summer of 1867. They describe the geological context and the methods used to collect and analyze the specimens, providing insights into the ancient flora and climate of the region.
